errors.description: A kernel-mode program generated an exception which the error handler didn't catch

solutions.description: Update all device drivers through Device Manager
solutions.details: Press Win+X, select Device Manager, right-click devices with yellow warnings, select 'Update driver'
Press Win+R, type 'mdsched.exe', restart when prompted
Reseat RAM modules and check all cable connections

errors.additional_info: Often caused by faulty drivers or hardware
errors.gemini_context: This error typically requires driver updates and memory testing.

errors.description: Invalid system memory references, usually indicating hardware problems

solutions.details: Download MemTest86, create bootable USB, run full memory test overnight
Use Windows Update and visit manufacturer websites for latest drivers

solutions.description: Run full system scan for malware
solutions.details: Use Windows Defender full scan or reputable antivirus software

errors.additional_info: Often indicates failing RAM or storage devices
errors.gemini_context: This is typically a hardware issue. Help users understand memory testing.

errors.description: A system thread generated an exception which the error handler didn't catch

solutions.details: Hold Shift while clicking Restart, select Troubleshoot > Advanced Options > Startup Settings > Restart > F4
Go to Settings > Apps & features, sort by install date, uninstall recent programs
Visit manufacturer's website, download latest BIOS update for your motherboard model

errors.additional_info: Usually caused by incompatible software or outdated system firmware
errors.gemini_context: Focus on recent software changes and system updates.

errors.description: A kernel-mode process or driver attempted to access memory at too high an IRQL

solutions.details: Disconnect USB devices, remove new expansion cards, restore to previous hardware configuration
Visit AMD/NVIDIA/Intel websites for graphics drivers, router manufacturer for network drivers
Right-click antivirus system tray icon, select disable protection temporarily

errors.additional_info: Usually caused by faulty drivers, especially network or graphics drivers
errors.gemini_context: Focus on driver conflicts and recent hardware changes.

errors.description: A critical system process terminated unexpectedly

solutions.details: Open Command Prompt as administrator, run 'sfc /scannow', wait for completion
Run 'net stop wuauserv', 'net stop cryptSvc', 'net stop bits', then restart these services
Type 'rstrui.exe' in Run dialog, select restore point before the issue started

errors.additional_info: Indicates corruption in critical Windows processes or files
errors.gemini_context: This is a serious system integrity issue.

errors.description: The kernel trapped an exception which was unexpected or unknown

solutions.description: Check CPU temperature and cooling system
solutions.details: Use HWiNFO64 or similar tool to monitor CPU temperatures. Clean dust from fans and heat sinks
Run extended memory test with MemTest86+ for at least 8 hours or multiple passes
Enter BIOS setup, load optimized defaults, disable any overclocking

errors.additional_info: Often indicates hardware failure, particularly CPU, RAM, or overheating issues
errors.gemini_context: This error usually points to serious hardware problems requiring immediate attention.

errors.description: A driver attempted to access pageable memory at too high an IRQL

solutions.description: Identify and update the problematic driver
solutions.details: Check Event Viewer for driver details, visit manufacturer website for latest version
In Device Manager, right-click device, Properties > Driver > Roll Back Driver
Boot in Safe Mode and uninstall recently installed programs or drivers

errors.additional_info: Most commonly caused by network, graphics, or audio drivers
errors.gemini_context: Help users identify the specific driver causing issues through Event Viewer.

errors.description: A problem occurred within the NTFS file system driver

solutions.details: Open Command Prompt as admin, run 'chkdsk C: /f /r', restart when prompted
Use CrystalDiskInfo or manufacturer's diagnostic tool to check drive health

solutions.description: Backup data and consider drive replacement
solutions.details: If errors persist, backup important data immediately and prepare for drive replacement

errors.additional_info: Often indicates failing hard drive or file system corruption
errors.gemini_context: This is a serious error that may indicate imminent drive failure. Emphasize data backup.

errors.description: A system service generated an exception error

solutions.details: Restart holding Shift, select Troubleshoot > Advanced > Startup Settings > Safe Mode
Open Command Prompt as admin, run 'sfc /scannow' followed by 'DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth'
Check Windows Update for pending updates or uninstall recent updates if problems started after installation

errors.additional_info: Can be caused by corrupted system files, bad drivers, or faulty Windows updates
errors.gemini_context: Focus on system integrity and recent changes that might have corrupted system services.

errors.description: A kernel-mode process or driver incorrectly attempted to allocate or free memory

solutions.details: Use Device Manager or manufacturer websites to update graphics, network, and storage drivers
Uninstall programs installed around the time errors started, especially security software
Use Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) and MemTest86 for thorough testing

errors.additional_info: Usually caused by faulty drivers or incompatible software accessing memory incorrectly
errors.gemini_context: Help identify recently installed drivers or software that might be causing memory allocation issues.

errors.description: A fatal machine check exception occurred

solutions.details: Use monitoring software to check CPU, GPU temperatures. Clean fans and ensure proper ventilation
Check PSU connections, test with known good PSU if available. Monitor voltage rails
Disable overclocking, reset BIOS to defaults, remove any hardware modifications

errors.additional_info: Indicates serious hardware problem, often CPU, motherboard, or power supply related
errors.gemini_context: This is a critical hardware error requiring immediate attention to prevent damage.

errors.description: A critical system process or thread unexpectedly terminated

solutions.details: Create Windows installation USB, boot from it, select Repair your computer
In recovery environment, select Troubleshoot > Advanced > Startup Repair
Use System Restore to previous working point or consider Windows Reset keeping files

errors.additional_info: Severe system corruption, often requiring repair or reinstallation
errors.gemini_context: This indicates severe system damage. Guide users through recovery options carefully.

errors.description: The display driver failed to respond in time and was reset

solutions.details: Download latest drivers from NVIDIA, AMD, or Intel websites. Use DDU to clean install if needed

solutions.description: Reduce graphics settings and disable overclocking
solutions.details: Lower game settings, disable GPU overclocking, set power management to maximum performance

solutions.description: Check graphics card temperatures and power
solutions.details: Monitor GPU temperatures, ensure adequate power supply, check for dust buildup

errors.additional_info: Common with graphics cards under stress or with driver issues
errors.gemini_context: Focus on graphics driver issues and GPU stability problems.

errors.description: Windows detected that critical kernel code or data has been corrupted

solutions.details: Use MemTest86 for overnight testing, test each RAM stick individually
Reseat RAM modules, graphics card, and all cables. Clean contacts with isopropyl alcohol
Remove all non-essential hardware, test with single RAM module, integrated graphics if available

errors.additional_info: Indicates hardware corruption, usually memory or motherboard related
errors.gemini_context: This suggests serious hardware problems requiring systematic testing and isolation.

errors.description: A driver attempted to write to read-only memory

solutions.description: Identify and update the problematic driver
solutions.details: Check crash dump details for driver name, download latest version from manufacturer
Boot to Advanced Startup, select Disable driver signature enforcement for testing

solutions.description: Roll back to previous working driver version
solutions.details: In Device Manager, find device, Properties > Driver > Roll Back Driver

errors.additional_info: Often caused by unsigned or corrupted drivers
errors.gemini_context: Help users identify the specific driver and guide through safe driver management.

errors.description: The kernel failed to read data from the paging file

solutions.details: Run 'chkdsk C: /f /r' from Command Prompt as administrator, allow full scan on restart

solutions.description: Check drive health and SMART status
solutions.details: Use CrystalDiskInfo or HD Tune to check drive health metrics and SMART data
Run Windows Memory Diagnostic and MemTest86 to rule out RAM issues

errors.additional_info: Usually indicates failing storage device or bad sectors on hard drive
errors.gemini_context: This often indicates storage device failure. Emphasize immediate data backup.

errors.description: A driver corrupted system memory pool

solutions.details: Focus on recently updated drivers, especially graphics, network, and storage controllers
Uninstall recently installed programs, especially those with kernel-mode components
Execute 'sfc /scannow' and 'DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth' as administrator

errors.additional_info: Caused by drivers incorrectly managing system memory pools
errors.gemini_context: Focus on identifying recently changed drivers or software that might be corrupting memory.

errors.description: The kernel detected corruption in a critical data structure

solutions.details: Execute 'sfc /scannow' followed by 'DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth' with admin privileges
Use Windows installation media, select 'Upgrade' to repair while keeping files and programs
Boot from antivirus rescue disk, run full system scan with multiple antimalware tools

errors.additional_info: Can indicate malware infection, system file corruption, or failing hardware
errors.gemini_context: This is serious system corruption that may require repair installation or malware removal.

errors.description: A severe memory management error occurred

solutions.description: Test RAM with comprehensive memory diagnostic
solutions.details: Run MemTest86+ overnight with multiple passes, test each module individually
Ensure paging file is properly configured, set to system managed or 1.5x RAM size

solutions.description: Update chipset and memory controller drivers
solutions.details: Download latest chipset drivers from motherboard manufacturer website

errors.additional_info: Usually indicates faulty RAM or memory controller issues
errors.gemini_context: Memory management errors typically point to hardware problems requiring systematic testing.

errors.description: A driver used too many Page Table Entries (PTEs)

solutions.details: Use Process Explorer or Resource Monitor to identify drivers using excessive memory
Focus on graphics, network, and storage drivers that might have memory leaks
Temporarily increase paging file size while addressing root cause driver issues

errors.additional_info: Often caused by drivers with memory leaks or excessive memory allocation
errors.gemini_context: Help users identify drivers consuming excessive memory and guide through memory management.
